ref: 12045 vīṭā f. ʻ small piece of stick shaped like a barley -- corn and struck in the game of tipcat ʼ MBh., ʻ a kind of metal ball held in the mouth in penance ʼ, vīṭaka -- n. ʻ a roll of betel and areca nut ʼ Pañcad., vīṭikā -- f. ʻ id. ʼ Daś., ʻ knot of a garment ʼ lex., vīṭī -- f. ʻ the betel plant ʼ lex. [This belongs to a group of words characterized phonet. by (1) initial v, b or zero, (2) ĭ̄ or ē or ū˘ or ō, (3) a single or double retroflex or dental stop, voiced or unvoiced, with or without nasal; and semant. by a general meaning of ʻ something round or rolled ʼ and more particularly as (1) ʻ a drop ʼ, (2) ʻ a lump ʼ, (3) ʻ a pad or mat ʼ, (4) ʻ something wrapped or wrapping ʼ, (5) ʻ a round stalk, stem, stick, handle ʼ: any of these meanings being liable to occur in any of the phonetic forms. Austro -- as. connexions have been proposed for some by Kuiper PMWS 32. See also vīṭī -- , viṭápa -- , vŕ̊nta -- 1, bindú -- , índu -- , iṇḍvà, uṇḍuka -- ]
Pk. vīḍiā -- f. ʻ roll of betel ʼ;
P. vīṛā, m. ʻ roll of betel, stopper of bottle ʼ;
M. viḍā m., ˚ḍī f. ʻ roll of betel, cigar, ring ʼ. -- *bīṭa -- :
Pk. bīḍaga -- n., ˚ḍĭ̄ -- f. ʻ roll of betel ʼ;
K. bīra m. ʻ hockey ball ʼ;
S. ḇīṛo m. ʻ roll of betel, large button ʼ, ˚ṛī f. ʻ button ʼ, ḇīṛaṇu ʻ to close up ʼ;
L. bīṛā m. ʻ cloth button ʼ;
P. bīṛā m. ʻ roll of betel, stopper of bottle ʼ;
G. bīṛɔ m. ʻ packet, large roll ʼ, ˚ṛī f., ˚ṛũ n. ʻ roll of betel ʼ. -- With v -- or b -- :
bhal. biṛo ʻ button ʼ;
bhal. biṛo ʻ button ʼ;
N. biro ʻ roll of betel ʼ, birko ʻ lid of a box ʼ;
A. birā ʻ betel -- leaf ʼ, ˚rī ʻ tobacco rolled in a leaf ʼ, ˚riyā ʻ roll of betel or cane, coil of straw to put under a vessel ʼ;
B. biṛā ʻ roll of betel, sheaf, packet, coil, rest for a pot ʼ;
Or. biṛā ʻ roll of betel, sheaf of corn, bundle, roll ʼ, ˚ṛī ʻ small do. ʼ;
Bi. bīr ʻ round block of iron placed on an anvil ʼ, biriyā ʻ roll of betel ʼ,
Mth. biriā; O
Aw. bīrā m. ʻ roll of betel and areca nut ʼ,
H. bīṛā m., bīṛī f.
